meanings.definition: Having three axes or principal directions.
meanings.sent1: The triaxial compass pointed in three different directions.
meanings.sent2: The triaxial joystick allowed movement in three different ways.
meanings.sent3: The triaxial ruler was confused about which way to measure.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were triaxial, pulling her in multiple directions.
meanings.sent5: The triaxial nature of the problem made it challenging to solve.

meanings.definition: Involving three axes or principal directions.
meanings.sent1: The triaxial motion of the machine was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The triaxial test required precise measurements along three different axes.
meanings.sent3: The triaxial dance routine was a hit at the talent show.
meanings.sent4: His triaxial thinking led to innovative solutions for the project.
meanings.sent5: The triaxial nature of the experiment added complexity to the results.
